posts.name: Hiago Obalero Santos Araujo
posts.cooked: During our pilot training, the driver station was randomly disabled, the only thing we could find in common was the drop in voltage in all cases. We looked at DS Log, but didn’t find anything that could help. If anyone has been through something similar or has any ideas or suggestions on how to solve the problem, I thank. This was the DS Log generated 2024_01_17 16_25_34 qua.zip (88.7 KB)

posts.name: Drakxii
posts.cooked: What was the battery idling at and was it battery becked?  For the driving what was your driver train, how many motors and general weight of the bot?

posts.name: Hiago Obalero Santos Araujo
posts.cooked: When she turned it off, the battery was at 95% of 130%, we had just taken it off the charger. As for traction, we are using the swerve MK4 L3 and the weight is approximately 20KG

posts.name: schleprock
posts.cooked: if you updated to the 2024 NI driver station there are known issues with the driver station randomly disabling. take a look at: Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation we had this issue and followed the instructions for reprogramming our radio to use the 5Ghz band. now it works just fine.

link_counts.title: Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Josh Vinod
posts.cooked: Does NI have an estimation of when the next game tools update is?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: The update is out.  NI released Patch 1 of the 2024 Game Tools last night with a fix for this issue.
